hints.content: Let's try each strategy one at a time to see if they work.

Add $60+20$ then add $21$.

$\begin{align}
\blueE{62}+\purpleD{21}&=\blueE{60}+\blueE{2}+\purpleD{20}+\purpleD1\\\\
&= \blueE{60}+\purpleD{20}+\blueE{2}+\purpleD{1}\\\\
&= \blueE{60}+\purpleD{20}+3\\\\
&\neq \blueE{60}+\purpleD{20}+\redE{21}
\end{align}$

**No**, this strategy does **not** work.

**The following strategy can be used to add $62+21$.**

- Add $62+1$ then add $20$.

question.content:
